habitat_description: E. traillii is generally restricted to dense willow thickets along running or open water (Grinnell and Miller, 1944; Sedgwick, 2000). It avoids tree cover, including that of arborescent willows (Whitmore, 1977). The species also can be found in tamarisk (Brown and Trosset, 1989). Never straying from water in the southwest (Harris et al., 1987; Paradzick, 2005), willow flycatcher nevertheless is reported to inhabit dry, upland shrub patches in the central and eastern portions of its range as well as in the Palouse (King, 1955; McCabe, 1991).
